Hi Peter, unfortunately I do not know of a HyperNEAT version with the "rt=
" code from rtNEAT.  You would likely need to alter whichever version of Hy=
perNEAT you are using to have the "rt" reproduction code, roughly approxima=
ting what is in the rtNEAT package:

http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/nn/keyw=
ord?rtneat

ken

> From: Dani=
el Tuohy <danielr2e@...>
> To: neat@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Sun, 7 November=
, 2010 4:19:18
> Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Financial trading with Hyperneat
>=
 
> =C2=A0 
> Peter,
> 
> What you want is a machine learning algorithm. =
=C2=A0The many flavors of NEAT are 
> indeed such algorithms, but NEAT is f=
airly exotic. My advice is to have a go 
> with WEKA. =C2=A0WEKA will provi=
de you with lots of different machine learning 
> algorithms (including neu=
ral networks), and it should be pretty easy for you to 
> figure out how to=
 set up an experiment with your data. =C2=A0It will very well 
> documented=
, and is likely to be easier to use for an ML novice than any NEAT 
> distr=
ibution, Hyper or otherwise (although I cannot speak from experience, so I =

> am perfectly willing to be corrected on this point).
> 
> Two words of w=
arning:
> 
> (1) Make sure you understand what it means to maintain a test =
set distinct from 
> the training data. =C2=A0Just because you have a model=
 that fits the data well does 
> not mean your model has learned anything i=
nteresting (i.e. anything other than 
> noise). =C2=A0If it predicts well w=
ith an unseen test set, then you've got something.
> (2) If you find yourse=
lf needing advice from the Weka community, you might want 
> to keep the na=
ture of your data to yourself. =C2=A0You are likely to receive the same 
> =
reception.=C2=A0
> 
> Good luck, and I encourage you to keep an open mind i=
f you should find your 
> models unable to predict anything of interest. =
=C2=A0And if that should be the case, 
> you will at least have had some us=
eful experience with ML and Weka that could 
> serve you well with future f=
inancial experiments.
> 
> Daniel
> 
> 
>

 between markets can=C2=A0

ket.

to simply use the

n up close or down for the next

edback from current market environment (Correct me if I'm wrong)

in my view is critical.

n the right direction.
